japan.name: Sake
japan.description: Traditional Japanese rice wine with a delicate, clean flavor profile
japan.glassware: Ochoko (small ceramic cup) or wine glass
japan.origin_story: Sake has been brewed in Japan for over 2000 years, originally as an offering to the gods. The brewing process is similar to beer but uses rice instead of barley.
japan.temperature: Can be served warm (45¬∞C/113¬∞F) or chilled (5¬∞C/41¬∞F)

japan.name: Matcha Latte
japan.description: Creamy green tea latte made with ceremonial grade matcha powder
japan.origin_story: Matcha was introduced to Japan by Buddhist monks in the 12th century. The modern latte version combines traditional matcha with Western coffee culture.

japan.name: Yuzu Sour
japan.description: Refreshing Japanese-inspired cocktail featuring the unique citrus flavor of yuzu
japan.origin_story: Yuzu is a Japanese citrus fruit that's been cultivated for over 1000 years. This cocktail modernizes traditional sake drinking with contemporary mixology techniques.

italy.name: Aperol Spritz
italy.description: Classic Italian aperitif cocktail with a perfect balance of bitter and sweet
italy.origin_story: The Spritz originated in Venice in the 1920s when Austrian soldiers added water to local wines. Aperol Spritz became popular in the 1950s and is now Italy's most famous cocktail.

italy.name: Limoncello
italy.description: Sweet, tangy lemon liqueur traditionally served as a digestif
italy.glassware: Small chilled glass or shot glass
italy.origin_story: Limoncello originated in the Amalfi Coast region of Italy, where lemons have been cultivated since the 11th century. It's traditionally homemade and served after meals.

italy.name: Espresso
italy.description: Concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans
italy.glassware: Demitasse cup or small ceramic cup
italy.origin_story: Espresso was invented in Italy in the early 20th century by Luigi Bezzera. The name means 'pressed out' in Italian, referring to the brewing method.

mexico.name: Classic Margarita
mexico.description: Iconic Mexican cocktail with tequila, lime, and orange liqueur
mexico.origin_story: The Margarita was invented in the 1940s, likely in Mexico or Texas. It's said to be named after a woman named Margarita, though the exact origin is debated.

mexico.name: Agua Fresca de Jamaica
mexico.description: Refreshing hibiscus flower drink with a tart, cranberry-like flavor
mexico.origin_story: Agua fresca (fresh water) drinks have been part of Mexican culture for centuries. Jamaica (hibiscus) was introduced by Spanish colonizers and quickly became a popular local ingredient.

mexico.name: Mezcal Old Fashioned
mexico.description: Smoky twist on the classic Old Fashioned using artisanal mezcal
mexico.origin_story: Mezcal is one of Mexico's oldest spirits, produced for over 400 years in Oaxaca. This modern cocktail combines traditional mezcal with classic cocktail techniques.

india.name: Masala Chai
india.description: Spiced milk tea with warming spices like cardamom, ginger, and cinnamon
india.glassware: Traditional clay cup (kulhar) or ceramic mug
india.origin_story: Chai has been part of Indian culture for over 5000 years. The word 'chai' means tea in Hindi, and masala chai became popular in the 20th century as a way to make tea more flavorful.

india.name: Mango Lassi
india.description: Creamy yogurt-based drink with sweet mango, perfect for cooling down spicy food
india.glassware: Tall glass or traditional metal cup
india.origin_story: Lassi originated in the Punjab region of India over 1000 years ago. It was traditionally served to farmers as a cooling drink during hot summer months.

india.name: Cashew Feni
india.description: Traditional Goan spirit made from fermented cashew apples
india.glassware: Small shot glass or traditional coconut shell
india.origin_story: Feni has been produced in Goa for over 400 years. The Portuguese introduced cashew trees to Goa in the 16th century, and locals learned to ferment the cashew apples into this unique spirit.

france.name: Kir Royale
france.description: Elegant French cocktail with cr√®me de cassis and champagne
france.origin_story: The Kir Royale was created in the 1940s by Canon F√©lix Kir, mayor of Dijon. It's a variation of the Kir cocktail, which uses white wine instead of champagne.

france.name: Pastis
france.description: Anise-flavored aperitif that turns cloudy when mixed with water
france.glassware: Tall glass or traditional pastis glass
france.origin_story: Pastis was created in 1932 by Paul Ricard as a replacement for absinthe, which was banned in France in 1915. It quickly became the most popular aperitif in Provence.

france.name: Caf√© au Lait
france.description: Traditional French coffee with equal parts coffee and steamed milk
france.glassware: Large ceramic bowl or wide-mouthed cup
france.origin_story: Caf√© au lait has been a French breakfast tradition since the 17th century. It's typically served in a large bowl to allow for dipping bread or pastries.

germany.name: Radler
germany.description: Refreshing beer mixed with lemon soda, perfect for summer
germany.origin_story: Radler was invented in 1922 by Franz Kugler, a Bavarian innkeeper. He mixed beer with lemon soda to serve cyclists who wanted a refreshing but low-alcohol drink.

germany.name: Gl√ºhwein
germany.description: Warm spiced wine traditionally served during Christmas markets
germany.glassware: Heatproof mug or traditional gl√ºhwein cup
germany.origin_story: Gl√ºhwein has been a German tradition since the 15th century. The name means 'glow wine' because it was traditionally heated with hot irons.

germany.name: Apfelschorle
germany.description: Refreshing apple juice mixed with sparkling water
germany.glassware: Tall glass or traditional beer stein
germany.origin_story: Apfelschorle is a popular German drink that combines the natural sweetness of apple juice with the refreshing fizz of sparkling water.

spain.name: Sangria
spain.description: Traditional Spanish wine punch with fresh fruits and brandy
spain.glassware: Wine glass or traditional clay pitcher
spain.origin_story: Sangria originated in Spain and Portugal, with the name coming from 'sangre' (blood) due to its deep red color. It's been a popular party drink for centuries.

spain.name: Tinto de Verano
spain.description: Summer wine cocktail with red wine and lemon soda
spain.origin_story: Tinto de Verano is a popular summer drink in Spain, especially in Andalusia. It's lighter than sangria and perfect for hot summer days.

spain.name: Horchata de Chufa
spain.description: Sweet, creamy drink made from tiger nuts
spain.glassware: Tall glass or traditional clay cup
spain.origin_story: Horchata de chufa originated in Valencia, Spain, where tiger nuts have been cultivated since the 8th century. It's a traditional drink served during festivals.

brazil.name: Caipirinha
brazil.description: Brazil's national cocktail with cacha√ßa, lime, and sugar
brazil.glassware: Old fashioned glass or traditional clay cup
brazil.origin_story: Caipirinha originated in S√£o Paulo in the early 20th century. It was originally made with honey and served to wealthy landowners, but sugar became the standard sweetener.

brazil.name: Guaran√° Juice
brazil.description: Refreshing juice made from the Amazonian guaran√° berry
brazil.origin_story: Guaran√° has been used by indigenous Amazonian tribes for centuries. The berries contain natural caffeine and were traditionally used for energy and medicinal purposes.

brazil.name: Batida de Coco
brazil.description: Creamy coconut cocktail with cacha√ßa and coconut milk
brazil.origin_story: Batida de coco is a popular beach cocktail in Brazil, especially in coastal regions. It combines the tropical flavor of coconut with Brazil's national spirit.

thailand.name: Thai Iced Tea
thailand.description: Sweet, creamy iced tea with condensed milk and spices
thailand.origin_story: Thai iced tea became popular in Thailand in the 20th century when condensed milk was introduced. The addition of spices like star anise gives it a unique flavor profile.

thailand.name: Fresh Coconut Water
thailand.description: Natural electrolyte-rich water from young coconuts
thailand.origin_story: Coconut water has been consumed in Thailand for centuries. Young coconuts are harvested when they're about 6-7 months old for the sweetest, most refreshing water.

thailand.name: Lemongrass Tea
thailand.description: Aromatic herbal tea with fresh lemongrass
thailand.glassware: Traditional clay cup or ceramic mug
thailand.origin_story: Lemongrass tea has been used in Thai traditional medicine for centuries. It's believed to have digestive and calming properties.

morocco.name: Moroccan Mint Tea
morocco.description: Sweet green tea with fresh mint leaves
morocco.origin_story: Mint tea is the national drink of Morocco and has been served to guests for centuries. The elaborate pouring ritual is a symbol of hospitality and friendship.

morocco.name: Almond Milk
morocco.description: Traditional almond-based drink with rose water
morocco.glassware: Traditional clay cup or glass tumbler
morocco.origin_story: Almond milk has been a traditional drink in Morocco for centuries, especially during Ramadan. The addition of rose water gives it a distinctive floral aroma.

morocco.name: Orange Blossom Tea
morocco.description: Fragrant tea made with orange blossom water
morocco.glassware: Traditional tea glass or ceramic mug
morocco.origin_story: Orange blossom tea is a traditional Moroccan drink that celebrates the country's abundant citrus groves. Orange blossom water has been used in Moroccan cuisine for centuries.

greece.name: Ouzo
greece.description: Anise-flavored aperitif that turns cloudy when mixed with water
greece.origin_story: Ouzo has been produced in Greece since the 19th century, particularly in the island of Lesbos. It's traditionally served as an aperitif with meze dishes.

greece.name: Greek Coffee
greece.description: Strong, unfiltered coffee brewed in a briki
greece.origin_story: Greek coffee has been a cultural tradition for centuries. It's brewed in a special pot called a briki and served with the grounds still in the cup.

greece.name: Greek Frapp√©
greece.description: Iced coffee drink with instant coffee and milk
greece.origin_story: Greek frapp√© was invented in 1957 at the Thessaloniki International Fair. It became popular as a refreshing summer drink and is now a symbol of Greek coffee culture.

china.name: Jasmine Tea
china.description: Fragrant green tea scented with jasmine flowers
china.glassware: Traditional Chinese tea cup or ceramic mug
china.origin_story: Jasmine tea has been produced in China since the Song Dynasty (960-1279). The tea leaves are layered with fresh jasmine flowers to absorb their delicate fragrance.

china.name: Baijiu Sour
china.description: Modern cocktail featuring China's traditional spirit
china.origin_story: Baijiu is China's national spirit, with a history dating back over 5000 years. This modern cocktail adapts traditional baijiu for contemporary palates.

china.name: Chrysanthemum Tea
china.description: Herbal tea made from dried chrysanthemum flowers
china.glassware: Traditional tea cup or glass tumbler
china.origin_story: Chrysanthemum tea has been consumed in China for over 2000 years. It's believed to have cooling properties and is traditionally served during hot weather.

cuba.name: Mojito
cuba.description: Classic Cuban cocktail with rum, mint, lime, and sugar
cuba.origin_story: The mojito originated in Havana, Cuba, in the 16th century. It was originally a medicinal drink made with local ingredients including mint and lime.

cuba.name: Caf√© Cubano
cuba.description: Strong espresso-style coffee sweetened with sugar during brewing
cuba.origin_story: Caf√© Cubano is a traditional Cuban coffee preparation method that creates a sweet, strong espresso. It's a daily ritual in Cuban households.

cuba.name: Daiquiri
cuba.description: Classic Cuban cocktail with rum, lime, and sugar
cuba.origin_story: The daiquiri was invented in 1898 by an American mining engineer in Cuba. It was named after the beach near Santiago de Cuba where it was first created.

cuba.name: Guarapo
cuba.description: Fresh sugarcane juice, a traditional Cuban refreshment
cuba.origin_story: Guarapo has been a traditional drink in Cuba for centuries. Sugarcane was introduced to Cuba by Spanish colonizers and became a staple crop.

korea.name: Makgeolli
korea.description: Traditional Korean rice wine with a milky appearance
korea.glassware: Traditional brass bowl or small cup
korea.origin_story: Makgeolli has been produced in Korea for over 1000 years. It was traditionally made by farmers and served during agricultural festivals.

korea.name: Sujeonggwa
korea.description: Traditional Korean persimmon punch with cinnamon and ginger
korea.glassware: Traditional Korean tea cup or glass tumbler
korea.origin_story: Sujeonggwa is a traditional Korean drink that dates back to the Joseon Dynasty. It's often served during holidays and special occasions.

korea.name: Yuja Tea
korea.description: Citrus tea made with Korean yuzu and honey
korea.glassware: Traditional tea cup or ceramic mug
korea.origin_story: Yuja tea has been a traditional Korean remedy for colds and sore throats for centuries. The fruit is preserved in honey to create a sweet, tangy drink.

russia.name: Kvass
russia.description: Traditional fermented bread drink with a tangy flavor
russia.glassware: Traditional wooden cup or glass tumbler
russia.origin_story: Kvass has been a traditional Russian drink since the 10th century. It was originally made by peasants using leftover bread and was considered a refreshing summer beverage.

russia.name: Mors
russia.description: Traditional berry drink made with cranberries or lingonberries
russia.glassware: Traditional wooden cup or glass tumbler
russia.origin_story: Mors has been a traditional Russian drink for centuries, especially popular in northern regions where berries are abundant. It's known for its high vitamin C content.

russia.name: Russian Mule
russia.description: Vodka-based cocktail with ginger beer and lime
russia.origin_story: The Russian Mule was created in the 1940s in Los Angeles, combining Russian vodka with ginger beer. It's become a popular way to enjoy vodka in cocktail form.

egypt.name: Karkade
egypt.glassware: Traditional Egyptian tea glass or tall glass
egypt.origin_story: Karkade has been consumed in Egypt for thousands of years. The hibiscus flowers were used by pharaohs and are mentioned in ancient Egyptian texts.

egypt.name: Sahlab
egypt.description: Warm milk drink thickened with orchid root powder
egypt.glassware: Traditional Egyptian tea glass or ceramic mug
egypt.origin_story: Sahlab has been a traditional Egyptian drink since ancient times. The orchid root powder was used by pharaohs and is still popular during cold winter months.

egypt.name: Tamar Hindi
egypt.description: Refreshing tamarind drink with a sweet-sour flavor
egypt.glassware: Traditional Egyptian glass or tall tumbler
egypt.origin_story: Tamar Hindi has been a popular Egyptian drink for centuries. The name means 'Indian tamarind' and it's especially refreshing during hot summer months.

ethiopia.name: Ethiopian Coffee Ceremony
ethiopia.description: Traditional coffee preparation with ceremonial significance
ethiopia.origin_story: Coffee was discovered in Ethiopia over 1000 years ago. The traditional ceremony involves roasting green beans over an open fire and serving three rounds of coffee.

ethiopia.name: Tej
ethiopia.glassware: Traditional Ethiopian glass (berele) or wine glass
ethiopia.origin_story: Tej has been produced in Ethiopia for over 2000 years. It's traditionally served during celebrations and is considered the national drink of Ethiopia.

ethiopia.name: Ethiopian Spiced Tea
ethiopia.description: Black tea with traditional Ethiopian spices
ethiopia.glassware: Traditional Ethiopian tea glass or ceramic mug
ethiopia.origin_story: Spiced tea has been part of Ethiopian culture for centuries, combining local spices with tea introduced through trade routes.

argentina.name: Yerba Mate
argentina.description: Traditional South American tea made from yerba mate leaves
argentina.origin_story: Yerba mate has been consumed by indigenous peoples in South America for centuries. It's a social drink traditionally shared among friends and family.

argentina.name: Fernet con Cola
argentina.description: Popular Argentine cocktail with Fernet-Branca and cola
argentina.origin_story: Fernet con Cola is Argentina's most popular cocktail, especially in Buenos Aires. It's often served as an aperitif before meals.

argentina.name: Dulce de Leche Milk
argentina.description: Sweet milk drink flavored with caramelized milk
argentina.origin_story: Dulce de leche is a traditional Argentine sweet made from slowly caramelized milk. This drink celebrates the country's love for dairy products.

lebanon.name: Arak
lebanon.glassware: Traditional Lebanese glass or rocks glass
lebanon.origin_story: Arak has been produced in Lebanon for over 2000 years. It's traditionally served with mezze dishes and is considered the national spirit.

lebanon.name: Jallab
lebanon.description: Refreshing drink made with dates, grape molasses, and rose water
lebanon.origin_story: Jallab is a traditional Lebanese drink that dates back to ancient times. It's especially popular during Ramadan and hot summer months.

lebanon.name: Mint Lemonade
lebanon.description: Refreshing lemonade with fresh mint leaves
lebanon.garnish: Fresh mint sprig and lemon slice
lebanon.origin_story: Mint lemonade is a popular Lebanese drink that combines the refreshing qualities of citrus with the cooling properties of mint.

peru.name: Pisco Sour
peru.description: Peru's national cocktail with pisco, lime, and egg white
peru.origin_story: The Pisco Sour was created in Lima in the 1920s by Victor Morris. It showcases Peru's national spirit, pisco, and has become a symbol of Peruvian culture.

peru.name: Chicha Morada
peru.description: Traditional purple corn drink with spices
peru.glassware: Tall glass or traditional clay cup
peru.origin_story: Chicha morada has been consumed in Peru since pre-Incan times. The purple corn gives it a distinctive color and unique flavor profile.

peru.name: Inca Kola
peru.description: Bright yellow soda with a unique bubblegum-like flavor
peru.origin_story: Inca Kola was created in Peru in 1935 and quickly became the country's most popular soft drink, outselling Coca-Cola for decades.

turkey.name: Raki
turkey.glassware: Traditional Turkish glass or rocks glass
turkey.origin_story: Raki has been produced in Turkey for centuries and is considered the national drink. It's traditionally served with meze dishes and fish.

turkey.name: Turkish Tea
turkey.description: Strong black tea served in traditional glasses
turkey.origin_story: Turkish tea has been a cultural tradition for centuries. It's served throughout the day and is a symbol of hospitality and friendship.

turkey.name: Ayran
turkey.glassware: Traditional Turkish glass or tall tumbler
turkey.origin_story: Ayran has been consumed in Turkey for thousands of years. It's a traditional drink that helps cool down during hot weather and aids digestion.

vietnam.name: C√† Ph√™ S·ªØa ƒê√°
vietnam.description: Vietnamese iced coffee with sweetened condensed milk
vietnam.origin_story: C√† ph√™ s·ªØa ƒë√° became popular in Vietnam in the 20th century when condensed milk was introduced. It's now a symbol of Vietnamese coffee culture.

vietnam.name: N∆∞·ªõc M√≠a
vietnam.origin_story: N∆∞·ªõc m√≠a has been consumed in Vietnam for centuries. Sugarcane juice is extracted using traditional presses and served fresh as a refreshing drink.

vietnam.name: Tr√† ƒê√†o
vietnam.description: Peach tea with fresh peach slices
vietnam.origin_story: Tr√† ƒë√†o is a modern Vietnamese drink that combines traditional tea culture with fresh local fruits. It's especially popular during peach season.

indonesia.name: Es Kelapa Muda
indonesia.description: Young coconut water served with ice
indonesia.origin_story: Es kelapa muda has been a traditional Indonesian drink for centuries. Young coconuts are harvested when they're about 6-7 months old for the sweetest water.

indonesia.name: Es Cendol
indonesia.description: Sweet dessert drink with green rice flour jelly
indonesia.origin_story: Es cendol is a traditional Indonesian dessert drink that dates back to the Majapahit Empire. The green jelly is made from rice flour and pandan leaves.

indonesia.name: Jamu
indonesia.glassware: Traditional clay cup or glass tumbler
indonesia.origin_story: Jamu has been used in Indonesian traditional medicine for over 1300 years. Each recipe is passed down through generations and varies by region.

nigeria.name: Zobo
nigeria.description: Refreshing hibiscus drink with ginger and pineapple
nigeria.origin_story: Zobo is a traditional Nigerian drink that has been consumed for generations. It's especially popular in northern Nigeria and is served during celebrations.

nigeria.name: Kunu
nigeria.glassware: Traditional clay cup or glass tumbler
nigeria.origin_story: Kunu has been a traditional Nigerian drink for centuries, especially in the northern regions. It's made from locally grown millet and is considered very nutritious.

nigeria.name: Palm Wine
nigeria.origin_story: Palm wine has been produced in Nigeria for thousands of years. It's made by tapping palm trees and allowing the sap to ferment naturally.

australia.name: Flat White
australia.origin_story: The flat white was created in Australia in the 1980s. It's similar to a latte but with less milk and a higher coffee-to-milk ratio.

australia.name: Bush Tucker Tea
australia.description: Traditional Aboriginal tea with native herbs
australia.glassware: Traditional wooden cup or ceramic mug
australia.origin_story: Bush tucker tea has been consumed by Aboriginal Australians for thousands of years. It uses native plants that have been sustainably harvested from the land.

australia.name: Coopers Sparkling Ale
australia.description: Traditional Australian beer with natural carbonation
australia.glassware: Traditional beer glass or pint glass
australia.origin_story: Coopers has been brewing in Australia since 1862. Their Sparkling Ale is bottle-conditioned, meaning it continues to ferment in the bottle.

canada.name: Maple Tea
canada.description: Black tea sweetened with pure maple syrup
canada.origin_story: Maple tea celebrates Canada's maple syrup heritage. Indigenous peoples were the first to harvest and use maple sap, a tradition that continues today.

canada.name: Bloody Caesar
canada.description: Canadian cocktail with clamato juice and vodka
canada.origin_story: The Bloody Caesar was invented in Calgary in 1969 by Walter Chell. It's considered Canada's national cocktail and is especially popular in western Canada.

canada.name: Ice Wine
canada.description: Sweet dessert wine made from frozen grapes
canada.glassware: Dessert wine glass or small wine glass
canada.origin_story: Ice wine production in Canada began in the 1970s. The grapes are left on the vine until they freeze, concentrating their sugars and flavors.

iran.name: Doogh
iran.description: Traditional Persian yogurt drink with mint and salt
iran.glassware: Traditional Persian glass or tall tumbler
iran.origin_story: Doogh has been consumed in Iran for thousands of years. It's traditionally served with kebabs and rice dishes to help cool down spicy food.

iran.name: Sharbat-e Sekanjabin
iran.description: Traditional Persian vinegar and honey drink
iran.glassware: Traditional Persian glass or tall tumbler
iran.garnish: Fresh mint leaves and cucumber slices
iran.origin_story: Sharbat-e sekanjabin has been a traditional Persian drink for centuries. It's believed to have medicinal properties and is especially refreshing in summer.

iran.name: Golab
iran.glassware: Traditional Persian glass or ceramic cup
iran.origin_story: Golab celebrates Iran's rich tradition of rose cultivation. The drink has been served to guests for centuries as a symbol of hospitality.

philippines.name: Calamansi Juice
philippines.description: Refreshing citrus drink with native Philippine lime
philippines.origin_story: Calamansi is native to the Philippines and has been used in traditional medicine and cuisine for centuries. The juice is especially popular during hot weather.

philippines.name: Taho
philippines.description: Sweet tofu dessert drink with tapioca pearls
philippines.glassware: Traditional taho cup or tall glass
philippines.origin_story: Taho is a traditional Filipino street food that has been enjoyed for generations. It's typically sold by vendors in the morning and is a popular breakfast drink.

philippines.name: Lambanog
philippines.description: Traditional coconut wine from palm sap
philippines.glassware: Traditional coconut shell or shot glass
philippines.origin_story: Lambanog has been produced in the Philippines for centuries, particularly in the Quezon province. It's made by fermenting and distilling coconut palm sap.

saudi_arabia.name: Arabic Coffee
saudi_arabia.description: Traditional coffee with cardamom and saffron
saudi_arabia.origin_story: Arabic coffee has been a symbol of hospitality in Saudi Arabia for centuries. It's traditionally served to guests as a sign of welcome and respect.

saudi_arabia.name: Tamar Hindi
saudi_arabia.glassware: Traditional Arabic glass or tall tumbler
saudi_arabia.garnish: Fresh mint leaves and date pieces
saudi_arabia.origin_story: Tamar hindi has been a popular drink in Saudi Arabia for centuries. It's especially refreshing during hot weather and is often served during Ramadan.

saudi_arabia.name: Laban
saudi_arabia.glassware: Traditional Arabic glass or tall tumbler
saudi_arabia.garnish: Fresh mint sprig and cucumber slice
saudi_arabia.origin_story: Laban has been a traditional drink in Saudi Arabia for generations. It's especially popular in rural areas and is considered very nutritious.

south_africa.name: Rooibos Tea
south_africa.glassware: Traditional South African cup or ceramic mug
south_africa.origin_story: Rooibos has been consumed by the Khoisan people of South Africa for centuries. The plant only grows in the Cederberg region and has become a national treasure.

south_africa.name: Amarula Cream Cocktail
south_africa.description: Creamy cocktail with South African marula liqueur
south_africa.origin_story: Amarula is made from the marula fruit, which elephants love to eat. The liqueur has become one of South Africa's most famous exports.

south_africa.name: Umqombothi
south_africa.description: Traditional African beer made from maize
south_africa.glassware: Traditional clay pot or beer stein
south_africa.origin_story: Umqombothi has been brewed by the Xhosa people of South Africa for centuries. It's traditionally served during ceremonies and celebrations.

chile.name: Pisco Sour Chileno
chile.description: Chilean version of the classic pisco sour
chile.origin_story: Chilean Pisco Sour is similar to the Peruvian version but uses Chilean pisco. The drink showcases Chile's excellent pisco production in the Elqui Valley.

chile.name: Mote con Huesillo
chile.description: Traditional Chilean drink with wheat and dried peaches
chile.origin_story: Mote con huesillo is a traditional Chilean drink that dates back to colonial times. It's especially popular during summer and is sold by street vendors.

chile.name: Chicha de Manzana
chile.description: Traditional apple cider from southern Chile
chile.glassware: Traditional clay cup or glass tumbler
chile.origin_story: Chicha de manzana has been produced in southern Chile for centuries, especially in the Araucan√≠a region where apple orchards are abundant.

sweden.name: Glogg
sweden.description: Traditional Swedish mulled wine with spices
sweden.glassware: Traditional Swedish glogg cup or heatproof mug
sweden.origin_story: Glogg has been a Swedish tradition since the 16th century. It's traditionally served during the Christmas season and is a symbol of Swedish hospitality.

sweden.name: Lingonberry Juice
sweden.glassware: Traditional Swedish glass or tall tumbler
sweden.origin_story: Lingonberry juice has been a traditional Swedish drink for centuries. The berries grow wild in Swedish forests and are rich in vitamin C.

sweden.name: Swedish Coffee
sweden.description: Strong coffee served with traditional accompaniments
sweden.glassware: Traditional Swedish coffee cup or ceramic mug
sweden.origin_story: Coffee has been a central part of Swedish culture since the 18th century. The traditional 'fika' coffee break is a beloved social institution.

poland.name: Polish Vodka
poland.description: Traditional Polish vodka with traditional accompaniments
poland.glassware: Traditional Polish vodka glass or shot glass
poland.origin_story: Vodka has been produced in Poland since the 15th century. Polish vodka is traditionally served with pickles and is considered among the finest in the world.

poland.name: Kompot
poland.glassware: Traditional Polish glass or tall tumbler
poland.origin_story: Kompot has been a traditional Polish drink for centuries. It's made with seasonal fruits and is especially popular during summer months.

poland.name: Herbata
poland.glassware: Traditional Polish tea glass or ceramic mug
poland.origin_story: Tea has been part of Polish culture since the 17th century. Polish tea is traditionally served with lemon and honey, especially during cold weather.

ukraine.name: Horilka
ukraine.description: Traditional Ukrainian vodka with honey and pepper
ukraine.glassware: Traditional Ukrainian glass or shot glass
ukraine.origin_story: Horilka has been produced in Ukraine for centuries. The name means 'burning water' and it's traditionally served during celebrations and holidays.

ukraine.name: Uzvar
ukraine.glassware: Traditional Ukrainian glass or ceramic cup
ukraine.origin_story: Uzvar has been a traditional Ukrainian drink for centuries. It's especially popular during Christmas and is believed to have health benefits.

ukraine.name: Ukrainian Kvass
ukraine.glassware: Traditional Ukrainian cup or glass tumbler
ukraine.origin_story: Kvass has been a traditional Ukrainian drink since ancient times. It was originally made by peasants using leftover bread and is very nutritious.

norway.name: Aquavit
norway.description: Traditional Norwegian spirit flavored with caraway
norway.glassware: Traditional Norwegian glass or shot glass
norway.origin_story: Aquavit has been produced in Norway since the 15th century. It's traditionally served during celebrations and is flavored with local herbs and spices.

norway.name: Cloudberry Tea
norway.glassware: Traditional Norwegian cup or ceramic mug
norway.origin_story: Cloudberries grow wild in Norwegian mountains and have been used in traditional medicine for centuries. The tea is especially popular in northern Norway.

norway.name: Norwegian Coffee
norway.glassware: Traditional Norwegian coffee cup or ceramic mug
norway.origin_story: Coffee has been central to Norwegian culture since the 18th century. The traditional 'kaffepause' is a beloved social institution.

israel.name: Israeli Arak
israel.glassware: Traditional Israeli glass or rocks glass
israel.origin_story: Arak has been produced in Israel for centuries and is considered the national spirit. It's traditionally served with mezze dishes.

israel.name: Limonana
israel.garnish: Fresh mint sprig and lemon slice
israel.origin_story: Limonana is a popular Israeli drink that combines the refreshing qualities of citrus with the cooling properties of mint. It's especially popular during hot weather.

israel.name: Turkish Coffee
israel.origin_story: Turkish coffee has been part of Israeli culture for centuries. It's brewed in a special pot called a cezve and served with the grounds still in the cup.

pakistan.name: Pakistani Lassi
pakistan.description: Traditional yogurt drink with rose water and cardamom
pakistan.glassware: Traditional Pakistani glass or tall tumbler
pakistan.origin_story: Lassi has been a traditional Pakistani drink for centuries. The addition of rose water and cardamom gives it a distinctive floral and spicy flavor.

pakistan.name: Rooh Afza
pakistan.origin_story: Rooh Afza was created in Pakistan in 1907 and has become a beloved traditional drink. It's especially popular during Ramadan and hot weather.

pakistan.name: Kashmiri Pink Tea
pakistan.description: Traditional pink tea with nuts and spices
pakistan.glassware: Traditional Kashmiri cup or ceramic mug
pakistan.origin_story: Kashmiri chai has been a traditional drink in the Kashmir region for centuries. The pink color comes from the reaction between tea and baking soda.

bangladesh.name: Borhani
bangladesh.glassware: Traditional Bangladeshi glass or tall tumbler
bangladesh.origin_story: Borhani has been a traditional Bangladeshi drink for centuries. It's especially popular during celebrations and is believed to aid digestion.

bangladesh.name: Bangladeshi Cha
bangladesh.description: Strong black tea with milk and sugar
bangladesh.glassware: Traditional Bangladeshi tea glass or ceramic mug
bangladesh.origin_story: Tea has been central to Bangladeshi culture since British colonial times. It's served throughout the day and is a symbol of hospitality.

bangladesh.name: Falooda
bangladesh.description: Traditional dessert drink with vermicelli and rose syrup
bangladesh.origin_story: Falooda was introduced to Bangladesh during the Mughal period. It's a popular dessert drink that combines Persian and Indian influences.

hungary.name: P√°linka
hungary.glassware: Traditional Hungarian glass or shot glass
hungary.origin_story: P√°linka has been produced in Hungary for centuries. It's made from various fruits and is considered the national spirit of Hungary.

hungary.name: Tokaji Asz√∫
hungary.glassware: Dessert wine glass or traditional Hungarian glass
hungary.origin_story: Tokaji has been produced in Hungary since the 16th century. It's one of the world's most famous dessert wines and was favored by European royalty.

hungary.name: Forralt Bor
hungary.glassware: Traditional Hungarian mug or heatproof glass
hungary.origin_story: Forralt bor has been a Hungarian tradition for centuries. It's especially popular during winter months and Christmas celebrations.

czech_republic.name: Becherovka
czech_republic.glassware: Traditional Czech glass or rocks glass
czech_republic.origin_story: Becherovka has been produced in Karlovy Vary since 1807. It's made from a secret blend of herbs and spices and is considered the national liqueur of the Czech Republic.

czech_republic.name: Pilsner Urquell
czech_republic.glassware: Traditional Czech beer glass or pint glass
czech_republic.origin_story: Pilsner Urquell was first brewed in 1842 in Pilsen, giving birth to the pilsner style of beer. It's considered the original pilsner and has influenced beer brewing worldwide.

czech_republic.name: Medovina
czech_republic.glassware: Traditional Czech glass or wine glass
czech_republic.origin_story: Medovina has been produced in the Czech Republic for centuries. It's made from fermented honey and was traditionally served during celebrations and holidays.

romania.name: »öuicƒÉ
romania.glassware: Traditional Romanian glass or shot glass
romania.origin_story: »öuicƒÉ has been produced in Romania for centuries, especially in rural areas. It's made from fermented plums and is considered the national spirit.

romania.name: Vi»ôinatƒÉ
romania.glassware: Traditional Romanian glass or liqueur glass
romania.origin_story: Vi»ôinatƒÉ is a traditional Romanian liqueur made from sour cherries. It's especially popular in the summer and is often served as a digestif.

romania.name: Ceai de Mu»ôe»õel
romania.glassware: Traditional Romanian tea glass or ceramic mug
romania.origin_story: Chamomile tea has been part of Romanian traditional medicine for centuries. It's believed to have calming properties and is often served before bedtime.

croatia.name: Rakija
croatia.glassware: Traditional Croatian glass or shot glass
croatia.origin_story: Rakija has been produced in Croatia for centuries. It's made from various fruits and is considered the national spirit, often served during celebrations.

croatia.name: Pelinkovac
croatia.glassware: Traditional Croatian glass or rocks glass
croatia.origin_story: Pelinkovac is a traditional Croatian bitter liqueur flavored with wormwood. It's often served as an aperitif and is believed to aid digestion.

croatia.name: Kava
croatia.glassware: Traditional Croatian coffee cup or ceramic mug
croatia.origin_story: Coffee has been central to Croatian culture since the Ottoman period. The traditional preparation method creates a strong, flavorful brew.

portugal.name: Port Wine
portugal.glassware: Port wine glass or traditional Portuguese glass
portugal.origin_story: Port wine has been produced in the Douro Valley since the 17th century. It's a fortified wine that became famous worldwide and is considered Portugal's most famous export.

portugal.name: Ginja
portugal.glassware: Traditional Portuguese glass or shot glass
portugal.origin_story: Ginja has been produced in Portugal for centuries, especially in the √ìbidos region. It's made from sour cherries and is often served in chocolate cups.

portugal.name: Bica
portugal.glassware: Traditional Portuguese coffee cup or demitasse
portugal.origin_story: Bica is the Portuguese term for espresso and has been central to Portuguese coffee culture since the early 20th century. It's typically served in small cups.

netherlands.name: Jenever
netherlands.glassware: Traditional Dutch glass or shot glass
netherlands.origin_story: Jenever has been produced in the Netherlands since the 16th century and is considered the precursor to modern gin. It's flavored with juniper berries and other botanicals.

netherlands.name: Heineken
netherlands.glassware: Traditional Dutch beer glass or pint glass
netherlands.origin_story: Heineken was founded in Amsterdam in 1864 and has become one of the world's most famous beer brands. It's a symbol of Dutch brewing tradition.

netherlands.name: Advocaat
netherlands.glassware: Traditional Dutch glass or liqueur glass
netherlands.origin_story: Advocaat has been produced in the Netherlands since the 17th century. It's made from egg yolks, sugar, and brandy, creating a rich, creamy liqueur.

belgium.name: Trappist Beer
belgium.glassware: Traditional Belgian beer glass or chalice
belgium.origin_story: Trappist beers have been brewed in Belgian monasteries since the Middle Ages. They are considered among the finest beers in the world and are still produced by monks.

belgium.name: Belgian Jenever
belgium.glassware: Traditional Belgian glass or shot glass
belgium.origin_story: Belgian Jenever has been produced for centuries and is similar to Dutch Jenever. It's flavored with juniper berries and other botanicals.

belgium.name: Kriek Lambic
belgium.glassware: Traditional Belgian beer glass or flute
belgium.origin_story: Kriek Lambic is a traditional Belgian beer made by fermenting lambic beer with sour cherries. It's part of Belgium's rich brewing heritage.

austria.name: Austrian Schnapps
austria.glassware: Traditional Austrian glass or shot glass
austria.origin_story: Austrian Schnapps has been produced for centuries, especially in the Alpine regions. It's made from various fruits and is considered a traditional digestif.

austria.name: Gr√ºner Veltliner
austria.glassware: White wine glass or traditional Austrian glass
austria.origin_story: Gr√ºner Veltliner is Austria's signature white wine grape. It has been cultivated in the country for centuries and is known for its distinctive peppery notes.

austria.name: Wiener Melange
austria.glassware: Traditional Viennese coffee cup or large coffee glass
austria.origin_story: Wiener Melange is the signature coffee drink of Vienna. It's similar to a cappuccino but with a distinctive Viennese style and has been served in coffee houses for centuries.

switzerland.name: Swiss Absinthe
switzerland.glassware: Traditional absinthe glass with slotted spoon
switzerland.origin_story: Absinthe was first produced in Switzerland in the late 18th century. The traditional preparation involves slowly dripping cold water over a sugar cube to create the characteristic cloudy appearance.

switzerland.name: Appenzeller Beer
switzerland.glassware: Traditional Swiss beer glass or pint glass
switzerland.origin_story: Appenzeller beer has been brewed in the Appenzell region for centuries. It's part of Switzerland's rich brewing tradition and is known for its quality and craftsmanship.

switzerland.name: Swiss Hot Chocolate
switzerland.glassware: Traditional Swiss mug or heatproof glass
switzerland.origin_story: Swiss hot chocolate has been famous worldwide for centuries. Switzerland's reputation for quality chocolate makes this drink a luxurious treat.

ireland.name: Guinness
ireland.origin_story: Guinness has been brewed in Dublin since 1759. It's Ireland's most famous export and is considered the national beer, known for its distinctive dark color and creamy head.

ireland.name: Irish Whiskey
ireland.glassware: Traditional Irish glass or rocks glass
ireland.origin_story: Irish whiskey has been produced for centuries and is considered one of the world's finest spirits. It's traditionally triple-distilled for smoothness.

ireland.name: Irish Coffee
ireland.description: Traditional coffee with Irish whiskey and cream
ireland.glassware: Traditional Irish coffee glass or heatproof mug
ireland.origin_story: Irish coffee was created in the 1940s at Foynes Airport to warm up passengers on cold transatlantic flights. It has become a beloved Irish tradition.

denmark.name: Akvavit
denmark.glassware: Traditional Danish glass or shot glass
denmark.origin_story: Akvavit has been produced in Denmark since the 15th century. It's flavored with caraway and other herbs and is traditionally served during celebrations.

denmark.name: Carlsberg
denmark.glassware: Traditional Danish beer glass or pint glass
denmark.origin_story: Carlsberg was founded in Copenhagen in 1847 and has become one of Denmark's most famous exports. It's known for its quality and consistency.

denmark.name: Danish Gl√∏gg
denmark.glassware: Traditional Danish mug or heatproof glass
denmark.origin_story: Gl√∏gg has been a Danish tradition since the 16th century. It's especially popular during the Christmas season and is a symbol of Danish hospitality.

finland.name: Koskenkorva
finland.glassware: Traditional Finnish glass or shot glass
finland.origin_story: Koskenkorva has been produced in Finland since 1933. It's made from barley and is considered the national spirit of Finland.

finland.name: Karhu Beer
finland.glassware: Traditional Finnish beer glass or pint glass
finland.origin_story: Karhu has been brewed in Finland since 1920. The name means 'bear' in Finnish and it's one of the country's most popular beers.

finland.name: Lakka
finland.glassware: Traditional Finnish glass or liqueur glass
finland.origin_story: Lakka is made from cloudberries, which grow wild in Finnish Lapland. It's a traditional liqueur that celebrates Finland's natural bounty.

venezuela.name: Cocuy
venezuela.glassware: Traditional Venezuelan glass or shot glass
venezuela.origin_story: Cocuy has been produced in Venezuela for centuries, especially in the Lara state. It's made from the agave plant and is considered a traditional spirit.

venezuela.name: Chicha de Arroz
venezuela.glassware: Traditional Venezuelan glass or tall tumbler
venezuela.origin_story: Chicha de arroz has been a traditional Venezuelan drink for centuries. It's especially popular during hot weather and is often served at celebrations.

venezuela.name: Caf√© Guayoyo
venezuela.glassware: Traditional Venezuelan coffee cup or ceramic mug
venezuela.origin_story: Caf√© guayoyo is the traditional way of preparing coffee in Venezuela. It's a strong, flavorful brew that's central to Venezuelan coffee culture.

colombia.name: Aguardiente
colombia.glassware: Traditional Colombian glass or shot glass
colombia.origin_story: Aguardiente has been produced in Colombia since colonial times. It's flavored with anise and is considered the national spirit, especially popular in the Andean region.

colombia.name: Chocolate Santafere√±o
colombia.description: Traditional Colombian hot chocolate with cheese
colombia.glassware: Traditional Colombian mug or heatproof glass
colombia.origin_story: Chocolate santafere√±o is a traditional Bogot√° drink that combines rich chocolate with fresh cheese. It's a unique Colombian tradition that dates back centuries.

colombia.name: Limonada de Coco
colombia.origin_story: Limonada de coco is a popular Colombian drink that combines the tropical flavors of coconut with the refreshing taste of lemon. It's especially popular in coastal regions.

ecuador.name: Canelazo
ecuador.glassware: Traditional Ecuadorian mug or heatproof glass
ecuador.origin_story: Canelazo is a traditional Ecuadorian drink from the Andean region. It's especially popular during cold weather and is often served at festivals and celebrations.

ecuador.name: Chicha de Jora
ecuador.glassware: Traditional Ecuadorian cup or glass tumbler
ecuador.origin_story: Chicha de jora has been produced in Ecuador for centuries, especially in the Andean region. It's made from fermented corn and is part of indigenous traditions.

ecuador.name: Colada Morada
ecuador.glassware: Traditional Ecuadorian glass or tall tumbler
ecuador.origin_story: Colada morada is a traditional Ecuadorian drink served during the Day of the Dead celebrations. It's made from purple corn and various fruits.

uruguay.name: Medio y Medio
uruguay.origin_story: Medio y medio is a traditional Uruguayan cocktail that combines white wine with sparkling wine. It's especially popular in Montevideo and is served in traditional bars.

uruguay.name: Grappamiel
uruguay.glassware: Traditional Uruguayan glass or liqueur glass
uruguay.origin_story: Grappamiel is a traditional Uruguayan liqueur made from grape pomace and honey. It's considered a digestif and is often served after meals.

uruguay.name: Mate
uruguay.origin_story: Mate has been central to Uruguayan culture for centuries. It's traditionally shared among friends and family, symbolizing friendship and hospitality.

new_zealand.name: Manuka Honey Tea
new_zealand.glassware: Traditional New Zealand mug or heatproof glass
new_zealand.origin_story: Manuka honey tea has been part of New Zealand's traditional medicine for centuries. Manuka honey is unique to New Zealand and is known for its healing properties.

new_zealand.name: Feijoa Juice
new_zealand.origin_story: Feijoa is native to New Zealand and has been used in traditional drinks for generations. The juice is especially popular during the fruit's harvest season.

new_zealand.name: Flat White
new_zealand.glassware: Traditional New Zealand coffee cup or ceramic mug
new_zealand.origin_story: The flat white was created in New Zealand in the 1980s and has become a signature coffee drink. It's known for its smooth texture and strong coffee flavor.

singapore.name: Teh Tarik
singapore.glassware: Traditional Singaporean glass or ceramic mug
singapore.origin_story: Teh tarik is a traditional Singaporean tea that gets its name from the 'pulling' motion used to mix the tea and milk. It's a popular drink in hawker centers.

singapore.name: Bandung
singapore.origin_story: Bandung is a traditional Singaporean drink that combines rose syrup with evaporated milk. It's especially popular during hot weather and is often served at celebrations.

singapore.name: Kopi O
singapore.glassware: Traditional Singaporean coffee cup or ceramic mug
singapore.origin_story: Kopi O is the traditional way of serving coffee in Singapore. The 'O' means 'black' in Hokkien, and it's a strong, unfiltered coffee served in traditional coffee shops.

malaysia.name: Teh Tarik
malaysia.glassware: Traditional Malaysian glass or ceramic mug
malaysia.origin_story: Teh tarik is a traditional Malaysian tea that gets its name from the 'pulling' motion used to mix the tea and milk. It's a popular drink in mamak stalls.

malaysia.name: Air Bandung
malaysia.origin_story: Air bandung is a traditional Malaysian drink that combines rose syrup with evaporated milk. It's especially popular during hot weather and is often served at celebrations.

malaysia.name: Kopi Kosong
malaysia.glassware: Traditional Malaysian coffee cup or ceramic mug
malaysia.origin_story: Kopi kosong is the traditional way of serving coffee in Malaysia. The 'kosong' means 'empty' in Malay, referring to no milk or sugar added.

nepal.name: Raksi
nepal.glassware: Traditional Nepali glass or shot glass
nepal.origin_story: Raksi has been produced in Nepal for centuries, especially in rural areas. It's made from fermented rice and is considered the traditional spirit of Nepal.

nepal.name: Masala Chai
nepal.glassware: Traditional Nepali tea glass or ceramic mug
nepal.origin_story: Masala chai has been part of Nepali culture for centuries. The blend of spices creates a warming, aromatic tea that's especially popular in the Himalayan region.

nepal.name: Nepali Lassi
nepal.glassware: Traditional Nepali glass or tall tumbler
nepal.origin_story: Lassi has been a traditional Nepali drink for centuries. It's especially popular during hot weather and is often served with meals.
